thread.title: Facebook nixes plan to limit data shared with advertisers
thread.title_full: Facebook nixes plan to limit data shared with advertisers - MarketWatch

author: By     Deepa Seetharaman
title: Facebook nixes plan to limit data shared with advertisers
text:
Facebook reversed a planned change to its advertising policy Tuesday, in the face of protests by game developers and other advertisers.
In May, the social network told advertisers it would no longer tell them how their mobile ads performed on a specific device.
Facebook FB, -0.08% said it would continue to provide metrics for an ad campaign overall, but would no longer offer “device-level reporting” showing how ads performed on individual devices. The company also said it would calculate and provide key metrics including the lifetime value of a customer directly to developers, frustrating developers who had built such systems on their own.
Game publishers and advertisers immediately pushed back, saying the change would make it more difficult to calculate the effectiveness of an ad campaign. They said the device information was helpful for retargeting ads and determine whether users who had seen an ad later installed an app. Advertisers also objected to using Facebook’s metrics after investing in their own analytics.
Initially, Facebook said the change would go into effect in August. It pushed that back to November after the uproar from advertisers.
